abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Expanding Microfinance
            Outreach and Improving Sustainability Project for
            Afghanistan were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            unsatisfactory, the risk to development outcome was high,
            the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: as a precautionary measure in
            fragile countries it may be a good idea to provide
            additional support to the qualified apex institution in
            determining eligibility of partner financial institutions
            due to changing dynamics in the financial sector. Security
            is a significant factor to consider for the viability of
            micro or Small or Medium Enterprise (SME) lending. As
            demonstrated in Afghanistan, the security situation can have
            a direct negative impact on portfolio quality. As a result,
            careful assessment should be made prior to rolling out
            operations in less secure areas. It is interesting to note
            that the only Microfinance Service Provider (MFP) that is
            operationally and commercially sustainable is First
            Microfinance Bank (FMFB), which is also a commercial bank,
            registered in line with banking regulations, and as such
            subject to all relevant prudential norms and related supervision.
